com.apriori.testing

Interface ObjectVerifier<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of object verified

    public interface ObjectVerifier<T>
    Verifies that an object sufficiently matches a reference value.
    Author:
    Joshua Humphries (jhumphries131@gmail.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T verify(T test, T reference)
      Verifies that an object sufficiently matches a reference value.

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        T verify(T test,
       T reference)
        Verifies that an object sufficiently matches a reference value.

        The return value will generally be the test object but a different value can be returned instead for various effects. If the verification fails, this method should throw an AssertionFailedError.

        Parameters:
        test - the object to test
        reference - the reference object
        Returns:
        a value to return to the calling test, usually test but could be reference or even a different object of the same type
        Throws:
        junit.framework.AssertionFailedError - if the test object does not sufficiently match the reference object
